wikitext.*:
'''''hûr''''' is a [[Noldorin]] word meaning "readiness for action, vigour, fiery spirit".<ref name=LR>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 364</ref>

Retaining the same form and meaning, ''hûr'' is commonly considered a valid [[Neo-Elvish|Neo-Sindarin]] word.<ref>{{HM|GS}}, p. 265</ref><ref>[[Didier Willis]], [http://www.jrrvf.com/hisweloke/sindar/online/english.html Hiswelókë's Sindarin Dictionary] at [http://www.jrrvf.com/hisweloke/sindar/index.html Jrrvf.com] (accessed 9 December 2011)</ref><ref name=Tolkiendil>[http://www.tolkiendil.com/langues/english/i-lam_arth/compound_sindarin_names Compound Sindarin Names in Middle-earth] at [http://www.tolkiendil.com Tolkiendil.com] (accessed 9 December 2011)</ref>

==Etymology==
*[[Sundocarme|Root]] KHOR ("set going, put in motion, urge on, etc")<ref name=LR/>
==Examples==

*[[Huor#Etymology|Huor]]<ref name=Tolkiendil/>
*[[Húrin#Etymology|Húrin]]<ref name=LR/>
